title: IT Team Coordinator
description: I direct a team of approximately 20 student technicians whose goal is to ensure that all printing/technology stations located around the campus are working smoothly and efficiently. This "Print Team" is a subset of the larger Campus Residences IT group - I coordinate the efforts of the Print Team with all other groups within C.R.I.T. to maximize effectiveness and efficiency.

title: Teaching Assistant
description: As a TA, I assisted students in SBU's "Systems Fundamentals I" course, which teaches MIPS assembly, Boolean algebra, and the basics of CPU engineering. I held one-on-one office hours (3 hrs/week) to answer student questions, and assisted the professor by creating and proctoring various quizzes and exams.

title: Contracted Developer
description: I was contracted by LaunchPad, an advertizing analytics startup company, to completely overhaul their product's web app. I was able to analyze their existing codebase and remove a considerable number of redundancies, while implementing a more modular and feature-rich API.

title: Private Tutor
description: For several years, I have been tutoring students in grades ranging from 2-12 as well as college students. Most frequently I help with mathematics (algebra, geometry, etc.) though I have also assisted with computer science, physical sciences, and developing skills necessary for essay writing and test taking.
